intro: Lycianthes nocturna, commonly known as nightshade tomato, is a flowering plant native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Solanaceae family, which includes other well-known plants like tomatoes and peppers. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom at night, hence its common name. Its fruit is a small, orange-red berry that ripens in the evening. The plant is often cultivated for its ornamental value and has some traditional medicinal uses.
